results.title: The Pacific century
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description: A series which describes and explains the emergence, from the nineteenth century onward, of modern nations from the rich and varied cultures and societies of Pacific Asia. A Study Guide and Faculty Manual are also available to accompany this telecourse.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: The Pacific century
results.creator_credit: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Pacific century”.
The final program in the series looks at America’s future as a “Pacific nation” by charting current economic and political trends, including the flood of Asian investment in the U.S., the domination of Asian technology and the rapid growth of Asian immigration. Through portraits of politicians, business leaders and working men and women “The Pacific century” will confront the economic, political and cultural challenges that will determine America’s future in this region to which it is inextricably connected.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: Sentimental imperialists
results.creator_credit: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at American attitudes towards Asia, from 1776 to the present. This is the story of merchants, missionaries and U.S. marines who, however well-intentioned, often saw in Asia what they wanted to see, rather than what was really there. The episode focuses on China and the Philippines, where policies of cold calculation mingled with deep sentiment for the region continue to influence US relations with Asia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: The Fight for democracy
results.creator_credit: Carl Byker, Jigsaw Productions, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program uses the recent history of South Korea to look at the way economic success in South East Asia is leading to greater democracy. A union member, a journalist, a women’s rights activist and a successful businessman are four characters in a powerful, emotional story of people demanding a greater stake and a say in the way their nation is run. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Byker, Jigsaw Productions, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: Big business and the ghost of Confucius
results.creator_credit: Peter Bull, Jigsaw Productions, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the rise of the South East Asian industrial powers of Taiwan, Singapore and South Korea and their rapid rise to the forefront of the world economy. Through portraits and interviews with business leaders and politicians, including Lee Kwan Yew and the chairman of Hyundai, the program grapples with fundamental questions about the role of government in economic growth, and the way rulers and ruled alike have invoked traditional values of loyalty to the state to meet modern economic goals. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.

results.title: Inside Japan Inc.
results.creator_credit: Alan Poul, Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Pacific century”.
The stereotypical view of Japan today is of a people working in harmony. However this is far from the truth. This program highlights the struggle of the Japanese people to gain basic rights in the workplace, and to find some purpose other than that of making money. The program also looks at how Japan Inc. has been allowed to prosper, partly through the triple alliance of politics, business and the bureaucracy, within Japan, and partly due to mistakes made by the Western world, in particular the United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Poul, Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: Reinventing Japan
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the peculiar relationship between Japan and the United States that emerged in the wake of World War II. Set to the tunes of big band jazz and including footage of the period never before seen, “Reinventing Japan” captures the spirit of a strange era, full of idealism and democracy as well as bitter betrayals, when one country tried to reinvent another in its image - with surprising and unexpected results.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: Writers & revolutionaries
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Steve Talley, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Pacific century”.
Revolutions often arise from the writings of men of ideas. This program looks at the crucial influence of Lu Xun and Kita Ikki on the Chinese revolution and the revolutionary transformation of Japan into a dominant military and economic power. Lu Xun set out to destroy traditional Chinese culture which he saw as backward, corrupt and complacent and became the greatest Chinese author of the 20th century and a major influence on Mao. Kita Ikki, by contrast sought a return to a pure and traditional spirit of nationalism which led to Japan’s imperialism prior to World War II. Rare archival footage, some of which is very distressing, enhances this fascinating program. A study guide and faculty manual is also available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Gibney, Steve Talley, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: From the barrel of a gun
results.creator_credit: Steven Talley, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This video looks at how two men - Ho Chi Minh and Sukharno destroyed the myth of western supremacy by tapping into the innate spirit of nationalism which had been repressed in the peoples of Vietnam and Indonesia. The video mixes archival footage, eyewitness accounts and expert commentary to show the roots of the Vietnamese war and the rise of Indonesia as a political power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Talley, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: The Pacific century. Study guide
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Pacific century”.
To accompany The Pacific century telecourse. The purpose of The Study guide is to aid students in their study of the telecourse material. Included are: an overview, identification of study resources, study focus statements, a listing of key concepts and names, a glossary, time-frame questions, questions for review and additional recommended readings.
